alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:41PM EST until January 12 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Estill County in east central Kentucky... Southeastern Montgomery County in east central Kentucky... Powell County in east central Kentucky... Northwestern Jackson County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 345 PM EST. * At 1241 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stanton, Irvine, Jeffersonville, Clay City, Ravenna, Cottage Furnace, Willow Tree, Hardwick, Cow Creek, Pitts, Fitchburg, North Irvine, Vaughns Mill, Doe Creek, South Irvine, West Irvine, Furnace, Calloway Crossing, Knowlton and Cobhill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
